arm_group.description: Home visits including physical activity promotion by the trained Community Health Workers.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to test a methodology of counseling on physical activity among
      Community Health Workers working within primary health care in Brazil.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity Promotion in the Brazilian Primary Health Care Using Community Health Workers Counseling

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an intervention study conducted with 176 people attended by two Primary Health Units
      in the city of São Paulo, Brazil. The intervention group received home visits of Community
      Health Workers trained on counseling on physical activity promotion. These workers received
      a course of 12 hours aimed to improve their knowledge and attitude about physical activity
      promotion. Evaluations will be done at the study baseline and 6 months after the beginning.
      The primary outcome is the population leisure-time and transport-related physical activity
      level.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years old or more

          -  To be registered in the Brazilian public health system

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Health problem or disease that would make the individual incapable of practice
             physical activity

          -  Cognitive problem or disease that would not allow the individual from answering the
             questionnaire alone

          -  To have plans to move house over the six-months subsequent period

          -  Being pregnant

intervention.description: Home visits including physical activity promotion by the trained Community Health Workers.

facility.name: School of Arts, Sciences and Humanities, University of Sao Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Physical Activity Promotion in the Brazilian Primary Health Care Using Community Health Workers Counseling

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline leisure-time and transport-related physical activity at 6 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline self-rated health at 6 months
Change from baseline stage of behavior change at 6 months
Change from baseline barriers to physical activity practice at 6 months
Change from baseline Community Health Workers's counseling on physical activity at 6 months
Change from baseline Community Health Workers's knowledge about physical activity promotion at 1 month
Change from baseline Community Health Workers's knowledge about physical activity promotion at 5 months
Change from baseline Community Health Workers's attitude about physical activity promotion at 1 month
Change from baseline Community Health Workers's attitude about physical activity promotion at 5 months

Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
